review_content: Can 500ml (in Korea). Clear pale amber colour, tiny white head. Nutty, sweetish, earthy hoppy aroma. Light-bodied. Bready, some fruity hops, sweetish finish. Not hopeless UK imitation.
Malty with a bit of citrus aroma. Flavor is lemony with medium malt. Gets rather sour lemon near the finish. Interesting at first and difficult at the end.

330ml bottle into tulip. Caramel malt nose. Golden amber beer with small white head. A few bubbles. Thin body, oily texture. Initial floral hop taste goes a bit ’juicy fruit’ then lingering lemon notes. I’m really enjoying this, easy drinking and tasty.

Queen’s Ale Blonde Type 5.4% pouring a deep copper gold with a fizzy head that vanished fast but did leave a bit of lacing behind. In a tulip the nose is actually fruity floral caramel, mild but decent enough and a pleasant surprise. A zesty med-full mouthfeel. The taste is sweet, a bit fruity and has some caramel hiding behind an earthy dirt like taste. Not sure what happened here, it’s not bad more like the taste is hiding in an underground cellar peeking out at you. Disappointing after the nice aroma, it just comes off as a lobotomized ale. OK I guess, once it warms up it melds better giving us a fruity caramel flavor.

Pours a clear, golden appearance with a white head. Dull lemon lime, bland grainy nose. Decent carbonation. Kind of chewy malty flavor. Some lemon. Really bland and very little hops. Not offensive at least.

Pour out of 12 oz bottle, clear orange pour with white head, aroma brought notes of biscuit, bread, vanilla, slight honey, hints of earth, grass, slight trashy notes, hints of earth. Taste is a mix of grass, bread, hints of trash, slight grain, hints of honey, finishing, slighty sweet, dry. Eh.

Pours a finger of head on a clear medium straw colored body.
The aroma has a nice tropical fruitiness to it: mango and pineapple mostly. 
The taste is on the lighter side. Mild lemon candy bitterness and some pine. A descent balance.
The texture is fizzy, which takes away from the otherwise nice profile.
Not bad if you’re looking for a light but flavorful beer.
